description: From French seringue, from Medieval Latin syringa, from Ancient Greek σῦριγξ (sûrinx, “pipe, syrinx”). Doublet of syrinx.

entries.meaning: A device used for injecting or drawing fluids through a membrane.
A device consisting of a hypodermic needle, a chamber for containing liquids, and a piston for applying pressure (to inject) or reducing pressure (to draw); a hypodermic syringe.

verbs.description: syringe (third-person singular simple present syringes, present participle syringing, simple past and past participle syringed)

entries.meaning: To clean or rinse by means of a syringe.
examples: Have your ears syringed! They're so dirty!

entries.meaning: To inject by means of a syringe.
